definitions.text: systematic arrangement of all the inflected forms of a word

examples: he is the prototype of good breeding
he provided America with an image of the good father

definitions.text: the class of all items that can be substituted into the same position (or slot) in a grammatical sentence (are in paradigmatic relation with one another)
the generally accepted perspective of a particular discipline at a given time
examples: he framed the problem within the psychoanalytic paradigm
